title: Uber Doesn’t Want to Be Expedia
sub_head: Ride-hailing company isn’t becoming an online travel agent—it just wants people to spend more time on its app
body:
You might be able to book your next vacation on Uber , but you won’t be able to book your next vacation with Uber. You aren’t the only one confused.
Headlines flew this past Wednesday suggesting that Uber Technologies was becoming the next Expedia after the Financial Times first reported that Uber would soon add long-distance travel bookings, including “trains, coaches and flights” to its U.K. app this year.
